page.title: 02Tourism Hutton-le-Hole Area
page.content: To the north of this area tourists are attracted by the open nature of the moorland.There are no buildings or fences to prevent them from sitting or wandering near becks or on open land, or just stopping to admire the view. There has been a great increase in day tourists in recent years,and many city dwellers come to relax and enjoy them- selves. In the southern farming part of the area there are beautiful views from open roadside spaces and woods, and there are many bridleways and foot -paths. Little children need no other entertainment than playing in the becks.People come to enjoy the beauty and peace and the great contrast from town life. Some come to visit the Folk Museum, and many have a cup of tea, an ice-cream, or patronize the shops.
